intro: Tanacetum aureum var. heimerlii, commonly known as the golden wood aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It features upright, branched stems that bear numerous small, bright yellow ray florets surrounding yellow disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, serrated leaves that are aromatic when crushed. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
